intro: Glaucium elbursium subsp. elbursium, commonly known as the Elburz gloryflower, is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. It is native to the Elburz Mountains in Iran, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features a basal rosette of lanceolate leaves with a waxy coating, and its flowers are borne on tall, slender stems. It is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
